tool.name: SAGA.ta_hydrology.16
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayELEV False isArraySEEDS False output_data_OUTDEPTH $output_data_OUTDEPTH output_data_OUTLEVEL $output_data_OUTLEVEL name SAGA.ta_hydrology.16 ELEV $ELEV SEEDS $SEEDS LEVEL $LEVEL prefer $prefer response $response outputType_OUTDEPTH $OutputSection_OUTDEPTH.outputType_OUTDEPTH transmissionMode_OUTDEPTH $OutputSection_OUTDEPTH.transmissionMode_OUTDEPTH outputType_OUTLEVEL $OutputSection_OUTLEVEL.outputType_OUTLEVEL transmissionMode_OUTLEVEL $OutputSection_OUTLEVEL.transmissionMode_OUTLEVEL

param.name: ELEV
param.label: DEM
param.help: digital elevation model The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, png, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: SEEDS
param.label: Seeds
param.help: seed cells coded with local water depth or absolute water level, all other cells NoData The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-envi, png, tiff, x-ogc-aaigrid

param.name: LEVEL
param.label: Absolute Water Levels
param.help: check this in case seed cells are coded with absolute water level

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_OUTDEPTH
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

param.name: outputType_OUTDEPTH
param.label: Lake
param.help: extent of lake, coded with water depth

section.name: OutputSection_OUTLEVEL
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format and the output value

tool.help: This tool can be used to flood a digital elevation model from seed points. Seed points have to be coded either with local water depth or absolute water level.<br/><br/>
